long_term_objectives.title_prefix: 1. North Star: Make a significant contribution to knowledge
long_term_objectives.objective: Position the research as a critically rigorous, strategically purposeful intervention that reshapes both scholarly discourse and public-facing design practice—anchoring epistemological innovation in real-world relevance while sustaining value far beyond the doctoral study.
long_term_objectives.why: Anchors the research in real-world and disciplinary relevance by producing work that is critically rigorous, strategically purposeful, and epistemologically transformative–shaping both scholarly discourse and public-facing design practice.
long_term_objectives.how: Aligns all theory and practice dimensions to a clearly defined trajectory, ensuring the work is not only methodologically sound but capable of reconfiguring design historiography and knowledge systems in ways that endure beyond the doctorate.

maps_to.tooltip: Digitise and computationally enrich the L. Bruce Archer and RCA Department of Design Research Archives using NLP, topic modelling, and ML.
Obtain ethical approval and formal access to archives at RCA and V&A East Storehouse.
Initiate computational analysis pipeline: OCR, NLP, topic modelling, and metadata schema setup.
Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.
Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.
Postdoctoral positioning metrics: submission of funding applications, invitations to collaborate, or confirmed research partnerships.

long_term_objectives.title_prefix: 2. Recast the archives to be fit for purpose
long_term_objectives.objective: Transform a historically static corpus into a generative research infrastructure through AI-driven analysis and participatory reclassification—bridging 20th-century design logic with contemporary digital humanities to enable real-time engagement and dynamic hypothesis modelling.
long_term_objectives.why: Transforms a static archival corpus into a generative research infrastructure–bridging 20th-century systematic design methods with 21st-century digital humanities, and repositioning it as a dynamic asset for scholarly, pedagogical, and public engagement.
long_term_objectives.how: Applies context engineering, machine learning and metadata enrichment (e.g., optical character recognition (OCR), natural language processing (NLP) and topic modelling) to digitise and activate the archive, embedding interactive modelling and simulation tools that enable real-time engagement with historical design hypotheses.

maps_to.tooltip: Digitise and computationally enrich the L. Bruce Archer and RCA Department of Design Research Archives using NLP, topic modelling, and ML.
Build, test and deploy the interactive taxonomy and visualisation platform, integrating linked open data and AI augmentation.
Obtain ethical approval and formal access to archives at RCA and V&A East Storehouse.
Initiate computational analysis pipeline: OCR, NLP, topic modelling, and metadata schema setup.
Prototype the first version of the interactive taxonomy using a subset of annotated data.
Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.
Successful implementation and usability score (from user testing) of the interactive taxonomy and visualisation platform.
Degree of semantic interoperability achieved via LOD compliance, open metadata formats, and platform API access.

long_term_objectives.title_prefix: 3. Build a durable infrastructure for open design research
long_term_objectives.objective: Establish a standards-compliant, open-access platform underpinned by linked open data, semantic metadata, and scalable taxonomies—ensuring long-term knowledge preservation, interoperability, and scholarly reuse across diverse institutional, educational, and public-facing design ecosystems.
long_term_objectives.why: Establishes the foundational material for long-term knowledge preservation and scholarly reuse–enabling future designers, educators, and institutions to engage with, extend, and reinterpret archival insights at scale.
long_term_objectives.how: Constructs an open-access, standards-compliant research platform integrating scalable metadata structures, linked open data (LOD), and transparent documentation–ensuring semantic interoperability and institutional adaptability beyond the doctoral scope.

maps_to.tooltip: Digitise and computationally enrich the L. Bruce Archer and RCA DDR archives using NLP, topic modelling and machine learning (ML).
Build, test and deploy the interactive taxonomy and visualisation platform, integrating linked open data and AI augmentation.

Number of expert interviews conducted, transcribed, and used to inform methodological or interpretive decisions.
Degree of semantic interoperability achieved via LOD compliance, open metadata formats, and platform API access.

long_term_objectives.objective: Fuse computational methods with critical design theory to challenge canonical classifications–developing inclusive metadata schemas, reusable research tools, and interactive taxonomies that expand epistemic frameworks and redefine the structure of historical design knowledge.
long_term_objectives.why: Positions the research at the forefront of methodological convergence between computational analysis and critical design theory–developing new epistemic frameworks for understanding, classifying, and modelling design history.
long_term_objectives.how: Synthesises context engineering, machine learning, critical theory, and user-centred design into a reproducible methodology. Outputs include a reusable metadata schema, peer-reviewed publications, and an interactive taxonomy engine to shape future disciplinary discourse.

maps_to.tooltip: Conduct qualitative interviews with design historians and digital humanities scholars to triangulate and refine the critical inquiry.
Conduct initial in-depth interviews with academic and archival stakeholders.
Number of expert interviews conducted, transcribed, and used to inform methodological or interpretive decisions.

long_term_objectives.title_prefix: 5. Embed pluralism into design history and knowledge
long_term_objectives.objective: Embed pluralism into design history and knowledge by recognising multiple cultural, methodological, and epistemological perspectives–challenging dominant narratives towards a more inclusive, representative understanding of design and design history.
long_term_objectives.why: Challenges dominant historiographical paradigms by embedding pluralistic epistemologies–ensuring that design knowledge evolves with cultural accountability, ethical depth, and representational integrity.
long_term_objectives.how: Implements critical librarianship and participatory metadata strategies to restructure archival classification. Conducts equity audits, develops inclusive vocabularies, and publishes open guidance for pluralist design research infrastructures.

priorities_and_activities.title_prefix: 1. Digitise and computationally enrich the archives
priorities_and_activities.objective: Digitise and computationally enrich the L. Bruce Archer and RCA Department of Design Research Archives using context engineering, NLP, topic modelling, and ML.
priorities_and_activities.why: Unlocks the archives as a dynamic site of inquiry by transforming analogue materials into machine-readable, semantically searchable content–enabling structured exploration, thematic analysis, and new forms of computational pattern recognition.
priorities_and_activities.how: Implements a scalable digitisation pipeline combining OCR, NLP, and topic modelling with semantic enrichment techniques–producing a structured corpus that supports downstream classification, taxonomy development, and real-time modelling.

maps_to.tooltip: Obtain ethical approval and formal access to archives at RCA and V&A East Storehouse.
Initiate computational analysis pipeline: OCR, NLP, topic modelling, and metadata schema setup.

Degree of semantic interoperability achieved via LOD compliance, open metadata formats, and platform API access.
Postdoctoral positioning metrics: submission of funding applications, invitations to collaborate, or confirmed research partnerships.

priorities_and_activities.title_prefix: 2. Conduct critical inquiry through archival research
priorities_and_activities.objective: Conduct critical archival inquiry through metadata structuring, critical librarianship, and marginalised voices historiography.
priorities_and_activities.why: Interrogates the epistemic assumptions embedded in archival systems by applying critical theory to expose exclusions, unsettle canonical hierarchies, and restructure inherited knowledge models from a pluralist perspective.
priorities_and_activities.how: Applies metadata restructuring, critical librarianship, and decolonial historiographies to classify archival content through inclusive ontologies–surfacing underrepresented narratives and challenging systemic biases in design historiography.

maps_to.tooltip: Conduct an initial equity audit of archival metadata schemas, identifying dominant voices, gaps, and opportunities for inclusive reclassification.
Number and diversity of inclusive metadata categories introduced through participatory reclassification (e.g., feminist, decolonial, user-centred taxonomies).

Number and diversity of inclusive metadata categories introduced through participatory reclassification (e.g., feminist, decolonial, user-centred taxonomies).Volume and quality of interdisciplinary engagement events (e.g., workshops, exhibitions, co-design sessions) and associated feedback data.

priorities_and_activities.title_prefix: 3. Build, test and deploy the taxonomy and visualisation app
priorities_and_activities.objective: Build, test and deploy the interactive taxonomy and visualisation platform, integrating linked open data and AI augmentation.
priorities_and_activities.why: Delivers the primary interface for interdisciplinary access, enabling new modes of engagement with design historiography and establishing a living, expandable platform for collaboration, critique, and knowledge circulation.
priorities_and_activities.how: Designs and deploys a public-facing platform integrating AI-enhanced classification, linked open data protocols, and modular visualisation tools–enabling scalable interaction, interpretive transparency, and open scholarly participation.

maps_to.tooltip: Prototype the first version of the interactive taxonomy using a subset of annotated data.
Successful implementation and usability score (from user testing) of the interactive taxonomy and visualisation platform.
Degree of semantic interoperability achieved via LOD compliance, open metadata formats, and platform API access.

priorities_and_activities.title_prefix: 4. Facilitate public-facing events to validate outcomes
priorities_and_activities.objective: Facilitate interdisciplinary workshops, exhibitions, and public engagement strategies to validate practice-based outcomes.
priorities_and_activities.why: Ensures the practical and cultural relevance of design-led tools through structured engagement with diverse publics, generating actionable feedback and situating the work within participatory research ethics.
priorities_and_activities.how: Coordinates co-creation workshops, exhibitions, and reflexive engagement sessions with academic, institutional, and community participants–using these as iterative validation points to refine outputs and surface context-specific insights.

priorities_and_activities.title_prefix: 5: Conduct qualitative interviews to refine the critical inquiry
priorities_and_activities.objective: Conduct qualitative interviews with design historians and digital humanities scholars to triangulate and refine the critical inquiry.
priorities_and_activities.why: Deepens methodological reflexivity and epistemic triangulation by embedding interpretive nuance from disciplinary experts–strengthening the credibility of computational findings and grounding critical insights in expert discourse.
priorities_and_activities.how: Conducts semi-structured interviews across relevant stakeholders, integrating perspectives from design history, archival theory, and digital humanities–using them to challenge assumptions, refine classification logic, and inform metadata restructuring.

Year 1.title_prefix: 1. Complete literature review and landscape mapping
Year 1.objective: Establish a rigorous conceptual foundation by mapping key debates in design historiography, digital humanities, and archival theory—clarifying epistemological frameworks, surfacing methodological precedents, and informing the research design for computational and participatory archival reinterpretation.
Year 1.annotation: Establishes foundational knowledge across design historiography, digital humanities, and archival theory. Supports long-term objective 3 and priorities and activities 5 by framing the epistemic context that guides methodological development and interview protocol refinement.

maps_to.tooltip: Evidence of the project’s scholarly and societal impact through citations, public engagement, and qualitative feedback from users and stakeholders.
Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.

Year 1.title_prefix: 2. Conduct initial equity audit of archival metadata schemas
Year 1.objective: Conduct an initial equity audit of archival metadata schemas, identifying dominant voices, gaps, and opportunities for inclusive reclassification.
Year 1.annotation: Introduces critical inquiry into systemic bias within the archive. Supports long-term objective 5 and priorities and activities 2 by laying the groundwork for pluralist restructuring and informing participatory metadata logic across the project lifecycle.

Year 1.title_prefix: 3. Obtain ethical approval and formal access to the archives
Year 1.objective: Secure institutional permissions and ethical clearance to access critical archival collections at RCA and V&A East Storehouse, enabling responsible digitisation, data extraction, and public dissemination while ensuring compliance with regulatory standards across academic, cultural heritage, and research governance contexts.
Year 1.annotation: Essential enabling step for long-term objectives 1 and 2, and priorities and activities 1. Ensures compliance with research ethics while facilitating digitisation, critical inquiry, and computational analysis across both institutional collections.

maps_to.tooltip: Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.
Postdoctoral positioning metrics: submission of funding applications, invitations to collaborate, or confirmed research partnerships.

Year 1.objective: Initiate computational analysis pipeline: Context engineering, OCR, NLP, topic modelling, and metadata schema setup through a structured digitisation and analysis pipeline—transforming analogue content into a machine-readable corpus for semantic enrichment, pattern discovery, and taxonomic reclassification using open metadata frameworks.
Year 1.annotation: Launches the technical infrastructure at the heart of the project. Supports long-term objectives 1, 2, and 3 and priorities and activities 1 by converting analogue archives into a structured, searchable corpus for semantic enrichment and downstream modelling.

maps_to.tooltip: Number of digitised and semantically enriched archival documents made machine-readable through OCR, NLP, and topic modelling.

Integrate expert perspectives early to inform classification logic, critical framing, and interpretive nuance—ensuring that computational methods reflect disciplinary expertise, institutional memory, and inclusive metadata structures grounded in reflexive and collaborative design historiography.
Year 1.annotation: Strengthens methodological reflexivity and triangulation. Supports long-term objectives 3 and 4 and priorities and activities 5 by embedding expert critique in early design of metadata schema, classification logic, and interpretive framing.

use_cases.lto-north-star: Use case: Identify all objectives and activities contributing directly to the overarching vision of the PhDits transformative purpose, scholarly ambition, and system-level impact.
use_cases.lto-recast-archive: Use case: Surface all initiatives that reinterpret the Archer archive as a dynamic frameworkbridging mid-century design logic with computational tools to support real-time hypothesis modelling.
use_cases.lto-ai-infrastructure: Use case: Track the construction of AI-augmented systems that underpin the taxonomyspanning metadata pipelines, retrieval logic, LOD structures, and semantic enrichment tools.
use_cases.lto-method-innovation: Use case: Highlight all research experiments that challenge conventional design historiographyespecially where machine learning meets metadata theory and critical librarianship.
use_cases.lto-recode-canon: Use case: Isolate work aimed at restructuring archival classification to surface pluralist, intersectional, and decolonial frameworks in design knowledge.
use_cases.pa-digitise-archive: Use case: Show all steps in digitising and enriching the archiveOCR, NLP, topic modelling, metadata setuptransforming raw files into searchable data.
use_cases.pa-critical-inquiry: Use case: Gather all objectives grounded in critical theorysuch as equity audits, metadata restructuring, and pluralist reinterpretation of design taxonomies.
use_cases.pa-interactive-platform: Use case: View activities contributing to the public-facing platformspanning visualisation tools, user testing, and linked open data compliance.
use_cases.pa-expert-interviews: Use case: Filter for qualitative engagementsinterviews with historians, curators, and technologists used to validate metadata and interpretive logic.
use_cases.ao-equity-audit: Use case: Audit the archive for representational imbalanceidentifying gaps, exclusions, and opportunities for inclusive metadata schemas.
use_cases.ao-literature-review: Use case: Track all foundational reading and methodological mapping across digital humanities, critical design, and archival theory.
use_cases.ao-ethics-access: Use case: Surface objectives related to research ethics, institutional permissions, and equitable access to archival material.
use_cases.ao-analysis-pipeline: Use case: Focus on the buildout of the NLP pipelineOCR, topic modelling, metadata scaffolding, and downstream inference setup.
use_cases.ao-stakeholder-interviews: Use case: Highlight participatory methodsuser/stakeholder interviews shaping taxonomic structure, tagging logic, and design priorities.
use_cases.ao-prototype-taxonomy: Use case: Show development of the interactive taxonomy prototypecombining computational findings with design-led UI experiments.
use_cases.kpi-publications: Use case: Track scholarly outputsarticles, talks, or catalogues that reflect academic contribution and research dissemination.
use_cases.kpi-taxonomy-usage: Use case: Measure real-world usage of the taxonomyadoption in teaching, research, or cultural institutions.
use_cases.kpi-inclusive-metadata: Use case: Audit inclusion-focused schema changesnew categories, tags, and classification logic driven by equity frameworks.
use_cases.kpi-interviews: Use case: Track interview outputsvolume, diversity, and how insights informed design and metadata decisions.
use_cases.kpi-digitisation: Use case: Measure progress in computational enrichmentfiles scanned, text parsed, and data structured for inference.
use_cases.milestone-binary: Use case: Track simple yes/no milestonesapproved, submitted, completed.
use_cases.milestone-technical: Use case: Surface computational and infrastructure tasksscripts, schemas, pipelines, and platform logic.
use_cases.milestone-structural: Use case: Isolate systemic decisionsclassification changes, content architecture, or platform schema logic.
use_cases.milestone-functional: Use case: View UX/UI deliverablesprototypes, feature logic, feedback loops, and user validation events.
use_cases.milestone-countable: Use case: Gather deliverables with numeric targetse.g., interviews completed, artefacts processed, metadata fields added.
